metadata.purpose: Stages functional decline in Alzheimer's disease from normal aging through severe dementia
metadata.primary_use: Clinical assessment, care planning, and research staging
metadata.validity: Highly correlated with neuropathological changes and cognitive decline
metadata.source: Reisberg, B. (1988). Functional assessment staging (FAST). Psychopharmacology Bulletin, 24(4), 653-659.

stages.clinical_characteristics: No functional decline. Normal cognitive functioning.
Subjective complaints of forgetting location of objects. Subjective work difficulties. No objective evidence of memory deficit on clinical interview.
Earliest clear-cut deficits. Manifestations include: decreased work performance evident to coworkers, difficulty traveling to new locations, decreased organizational capacity.

functional_status.cognition: Mild impairment detectable on careful clinical assessment
functional_status.iadl_status: Beginning difficulty with complex IADLs (work performance, traveling to new locations)

stages.typical_duration: Approximately 7 years before more severe symptoms
stages.care_needs: May benefit from memory aids, simplified environment, routine establishment

stages.clinical_characteristics: Clear-cut deficit on careful clinical interview. Deficit manifest in: decreased knowledge of current and recent events, deficit in memory of personal history, decreased concentration on serial subtractions, decreased ability to travel, handle finances, etc.

functional_status.adl_status: Independent in most ADLs (may need prompting)
functional_status.iadl_status: Impaired in complex IADLs: managing finances, medication management, using transportation

stages.care_needs: Supervision for complex tasks, financial management assistance, medication management support

stages.clinical_characteristics: Patient can no longer survive without some assistance. Unable to recall major relevant aspects of current life, e.g., address, telephone number, names of close family members, name of high school or college attended. Often disoriented to date or season.

functional_status.adl_status: Needs assistance with selecting proper clothing. May need prompting to bathe.

stages.care_needs: Daily supervision, assistance with clothing selection, prompting for hygiene, safety monitoring

stages.stage_name: Moderately Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Improperly Putting on Clothes
stages.clinical_characteristics: Difficulty putting on clothing properly without assistance. May put clothing on in wrong sequence, forget items.
stages.care_needs: Physical assistance with dressing, complete supervision

stages.stage_name: Moderately Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Unable to Bathe Properly
stages.clinical_characteristics: Unable to bathe properly (e.g., difficulty adjusting bathwater temperature). Requires assistance to avoid safety issues.

functional_status.adl_status: Requires assistance with bathing and dressing

stages.care_needs: Complete bathing assistance, fall prevention, temperature safety monitoring

stages.stage_name: Moderately Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Inability to Handle Mechanics of Toileting
stages.clinical_characteristics: Inability to handle mechanics of toileting (e.g., forgets to flush, doesn't wipe properly, improper disposal of tissue).

functional_status.adl_status: Requires assistance with dressing, bathing, and toileting mechanics

stages.care_needs: Toileting assistance, hygiene support, dignity preservation

stages.stage_name: Moderately Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Urinary Incontinence

functional_status.adl_status: Incontinent of urine. Requires assistance with all ADLs except eating and ambulating.

stages.care_needs: Incontinence management, scheduled toileting, skin care, dignity preservation

stages.stage_name: Moderately Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Fecal Incontinence

functional_status.adl_status: Incontinent of urine and bowel. Requires assistance with all ADLs except eating and ambulating.

stages.care_needs: Complete incontinence management, comprehensive hygiene care, skin integrity monitoring

stages.stage_name: Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Ability to Speak Limited to 1-5 Words
stages.clinical_characteristics: Speech ability is limited to approximately a half-dozen intelligible different words in the course of an average day.

functional_status.adl_status: Dependent in all ADLs except may retain some ability to ambulate

stages.care_needs: Total care, communication support, emotional comfort, non-verbal communication techniques

stages.stage_name: Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Intelligible Vocabulary Limited to a Single Word
stages.clinical_characteristics: Speech ability is limited to the use of a single intelligible word in an average day (the person may repeat the word over and over).

functional_status.adl_status: Dependent in all ADLs except may retain some ability to ambulate

stages.care_needs: Total care, comfort measures, alternative communication methods

stages.stage_name: Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Ambulatory Ability Lost
stages.clinical_characteristics: Ability to walk has been lost (cannot walk without personal assistance).
stages.care_needs: Total care, mobility assistance, pressure ulcer prevention, range of motion exercises

stages.stage_name: Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Ability to Sit Up Lost
stages.clinical_characteristics: Ability to sit up without assistance has been lost (the person will fall over if there is no lateral support, such as armrests).

functional_status.adl_status: Cannot sit without support. Dependent in all ADLs.

stages.care_needs: Total care, positioning support, aspiration precautions, pressure ulcer prevention

stages.stage_name: Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Ability to Smile Lost

functional_status.adl_status: Cannot sit without support. Dependent in all ADLs.

stages.care_needs: Total care, comfort measures, sensory stimulation, dignity preservation

stages.stage_name: Severe Alzheimer's Disease - Ability to Hold Head Up Lost
stages.clinical_characteristics: Loss of ability to hold head up independently.

functional_status.adl_status: Cannot hold head up. Completely dependent in all ADLs.

stages.care_needs: Total care, comfort measures, aspiration prevention, end-of-life care considerations

clinical_notes.progression: FAST stages generally progress in order, though individual variation exists. Stages 6 and 7 have substages that typically occur sequentially.
clinical_notes.assessment_frequency: Assessment should be conducted every 6-12 months in early stages, more frequently in later stages.
clinical_notes.reliability: FAST demonstrates high inter-rater reliability and correlation with cognitive decline measures.
clinical_notes.limitations: Primarily validated in Alzheimer's disease; may not apply to other dementias. Does not capture all aspects of behavior and psychiatric symptoms.

usage_for_wp02.mapping_approach: Each FAST stage will be mapped to specific ADL/IADL impairments in WP-02
usage_for_wp02.granularity: Substages (6a-6e, 7a-7f) provide detailed functional markers for precise capability mapping
key_transitions: Stage 7a-7f: Progressive loss of basic functions
